image.altText: Bridget Archer

props.synopsis: Former federal Liberal MP Bridget Archer once said a Hobart AFL stadium was "unnecessary". Now she says she supports the project, just days after seeking Liberal preselection for a possible state election.

title.children: Bridget Archer changes tack to back Hobart stadium '100 per cent'

image.altText: A large white coral-like boulder tube and a scuba diver in deep blue water.

props.synopsis: Damage to sensitive sea floor ecosystems sparks calls for tighter regulation of the tourist ship industry in the Antarctic region.

title.children: World-first footage shows Antarctic sea floor scoured by cruise ship anchors

image.altText: A woman clasps her hand in front of her face in front of a mirror

props.synopsis: Last year, more than 1,700 orders for involuntary electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) were approved by tribunals in Australia. Advocacy groups say clinicians need to be better informed.

title.children: Thousands of Australians receiving ECT without consent every year

image.altText: Two women in white and blue blouses smile down at a baby sitting next to windows with beige curtains.

props.synopsis: Meagan White says surrogacy was her only option to become a mother. Her own mother stepped in as surrogate twice. But others aren't so fortunate, and some say Tasmanian surrogacy law places unfair restrictions on those who choose surrogacy.

title.children: Calls to change Tasmania's 'unfair' surrogacy law

image.altText: Dean Winter standing in the chamber.

props.synopsis: The leaders of both of Tasmania's major political parties double down on their support for the proposed Macquarie Point stadium as an early election appears likely.

title.children: 'Not giving it up for anything': Tasmanian Labor leader firm on stadium

image.altText: Baz Luhrmann wearing a dark green and silver suit and Catherine Martin in a dark green long sleeve dress with silver flowers

props.synopsis: Some 830 Australians will be recognised as part of the King's Birthday 2025 Honours on Monday, including film director Baz Luhrmann and his frequent collaborator Catherine Martin, an award-winning costume, production and set designer.

title.children: King's Birthday Honours List includes Hollywood heavyweights, local heroes

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a hoodie. He is looking straight ahead with a slightly sad expression.

props.synopsis: Beneath the profitable success story of the UFC lies a hidden reality: many athletes who have dedicated their careers to the sport are struggling and are unable to fight back.

title.children: Tyson was 'willing to die' for the UFC. He changed his mind after getting paid

image.altText: The former PM seated and grinning

props.synopsis: The 30th prime minister has been appointed a Companion of the Order of Australia for his "eminent service" to the country and direction during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: Scott Morrison receives Australia's highest honour for COVID leadership

image.altText: A woman smiles in front of a dark backdrop

props.synopsis: Northern Territory federal MP Marion Scrymgour slams current and former governments for "taking their eye off the ball" regarding Aboriginal deaths in custody, while a grieving grandfather tells police to "get off our backs".

title.children: MP slams governments for lack of leadership over black deaths in custody

image.altText: Sarah Snook standing on stage with an award and a microphone in front of her, wearing a tight fitting glittery dress

props.synopsis: Australian actor Sarah Snook has won the Tony award for Best Leading Actress in a Play for The Picture of Dorian Gray, with fellow Australian Marg Horwell also taking home a Tony for Costume Design.

title.children: Sarah Snook wins Tony award for lead performance in The Picture of Dorian Gray

image.altText: A man standing in desert bush land rests his arms on a shovel.

props.synopsis: Indigenous employment rules have been dropped from two-thirds of Commonwealth contracts, meaning $70 billion worth of contracts did not have to hire a minimum number of Indigenous people or use Indigenous businesses.

title.children: Indigenous employment rules dropped from most Commonwealth contracts

image.altText: The SES and Victoria Police are rescuing about 20 people stuck on Mount Hotham.

props.synopsis: Half a dozen people remain stuck in their vehicles after heavy snow caught travellers unaware in Victoria's alpine region.

title.children: 'Treacherous' rescue continues for people stuck in snow on Mt Hotham

image.altText: A woman in silhouette standing looking out a window

props.synopsis: Jane was shocked to find she could not use her frozen eggs for IVF in WA, all because she was a single woman with no reproductive health problems — forcing her on an expensive and lonely interstate mission.

title.children: Woman left a 'reproductive refugee' after being denied her choice

image.altText: Jess Fox

props.synopsis: Jessica Fox doesn't add to her victory in the C1 on the final day of action at the opening Canoe Slalom World Cup.

title.children: Fox looks ahead after mixed fortunes at the opening Canoe Slalom World Cup

image.altText: GettyImages-2219227055

props.synopsis: Jannik Sinner says his loss to Carlos Alcaraz in the French Open final "hurts", after missing a chance to make history.

title.children: 'This one hurts': Sinner rues missed opportunity from French Open epic

image.altText: A hazy view of mountains over suburbia.

props.synopsis: The state government claims there are some recipients earning well above the income limit that determines who is eligible for social housing.

title.children: Queensland to review social housing after finding couple making $200k

image.altText: A large white coral-like boulder tube and a scuba diver in deep blue water.

props.synopsis: Damage to sensitive sea floor ecosystems sparks calls for tighter regulation of the tourist ship industry in the Antarctic region.

title.children: World-first footage shows Antarctic sea floor scoured by cruise ship anchors

image.altText: Generic disposable coffee cup held in a hand with beach in background.

props.synopsis: US tariffs and supply issues are creating uncertainty for an already strained coffee market, and roasters say it's only a matter of time before Australians will pay more for their brew.

title.children: Coffee prices up to $12 needed to make industry viable, supplier says

image.altText: Police walk men arrested out of a plane

props.synopsis: Four men who allegedly threatened a couple and demanded money during a home invasion on the Sunshine Coast are extradited from NSW to Queensland.

title.children: Four Qld men extradited from NSW over 'vicious' alleged home invasion

image.altText: A woman in a pink top holing her war medals in her right hand and looking directly into the camera.

props.synopsis: The private hospitals association blames the facility's shut down and the potential closure of others on health insurers, but a representative for insurers rejects the accusation and says how we fund mental health must change.

title.children: Private mental health hospital closure in Brisbane 'just the tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: Queensland Maroons player Daly Cherry-Evans puts his hands on his head during State of origin II.

props.synopsis: Having taken Queensland from a rabble to its bright future with a slew of iconic performances, it can be easy to forget how recently Daly Cherry-Evans was on the State of Origin scrap heap. Now, his place in Queensland history is secure.

title.children: Why Cherry-Evans might just be the greatest Maroons halfback

image.altText: A side profile view of Roger Cook who is smiling while wearing a suit

props.synopsis: Western Australians could see a realignment of public holidays to coincide with the east coast and have an additional public holiday added to the calendar as soon as next year, WA Premier Roger Cook says.

title.children: Roger Cook flags shake-up of WA public holiday calendar

image.altText: Three children on a large dinosaur statue.

props.synopsis: An unexpected online auction buy lands an 8-metre-long, 3m-high dinosaur in a Milang front yard, bringing smiles and new visitors to the struggling town.

title.children: How an impulse purchase gone wrong became town's unofficial mascot

image.altText: Black snakes inside a large plastic tub.

props.synopsis: Mud and mould aren't the only issues facing those returning home after major flooding in northern NSW, as animals take refuge in flood-impacted properties.

title.children: Flooded-out family discovers more than 30 snakes upon return

image.altText: Supporters watch on from the hill and stands behind the goals during the game.

props.synopsis: AFL fans set a crowd record at Bunbury for the AFL's first regional Western Australian game and one of two North Melbourne home games in the state.

title.children: WA's $2.5m to bring AFL games to state put to test with regional debut

image.altText: Officers stand near a police car on a taped off road in a country town.

props.synopsis: Police are calling for information from the public after a man died in an early-morning shooting at Wagga Wagga in the NSW Riverina region.

title.children: Homicide squad called in after man shot dead in Wagga Wagga

image.altText: a coastal town

props.synopsis: The owners of Bremer Bay Resort say Western Power told them purchasing a diesel generator was the only way to avoid the outages plaguing the small community.

title.children: Hotelier angry at blackouts says power provider advised buying a generator

props.synopsis: The oil and gas giant Woodside has been handed a big win by Labor, with the life of its massive gas plant in Western Australia extended until 2070. But given that almost all the gas is sent overseas, what’s it in for Australian taxpayers and what about the climate?

title.children: Woodside’s massive gas extension explained

image.altText: Girl and boy holding boogie board and hockey sticks in vineyard covered by snow

props.synopsis: People across swathes of inland NSW have woken to a dusting of snow, marking the first fall of the season for some regions.

title.children: City of Orange turns white as snow blankets inland NSW

image.altText: Tiny blue fish swim above white, spindly corals.

props.synopsis: After just one generation of breeding, scientists say they have been able to double the heat tolerance of Ningaloo Reef coral using re-engineering techniques first developed at the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Scientists breed coral bleaching resistance on Ningaloo Reef

image.altText: A male ABC presenter stands behind a table in a hay shed. He's wearing headphones and is hoping a microphone.

props.synopsis: Victorian Country Hour host Warwick Long reflects on how farmers focus on mental health, modern farming practices and climate change preparation.

title.children: Victoria is in the grip of drought, but what's different about this one?

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair smiles, she has a nose ring.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Attorney-General says Courtney Anderson's family provided new information and shared their concerns that the case was not fully investigated.

title.children: Inquest for woman who died after fall from moving car on Bruce Highway

image.altText: A bearded man holds a surf board while standing on the beach.

props.synopsis: A Catholic priest and bravery award recipient rescues a father and son who were struggling to swim at Cable Beach in Western Australia's north.

title.children: Surfing priest saves swimmers at iconic WA beach

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a garden wall made of Spanish moss.

props.synopsis: At 96, gardener Patricia Bate needs plants that are low maintenance.

title.children: Three easy-to-grow plants that look after themselves
